Master Answer:
In general, people who have cancer are considered to be at high-risk for serious illness from influenza (the flu) and should get the inactivated influenza vaccine. If you received a checkpoint inhibitor to treat cancer, this may affect the timing of when you should get the vaccine. Please speak with your health care provider about getting vaccinated. 
Immunization Nurse
Master Question: I have just finished chemotherapy and my cancer is now in remission (as of Sept 6, 2019). Is it safe for me to get a flu shot now?
